assessment_comment: Small system.  Low value habitat.  Slope estimated visually.. 16:12:04
Good flow. Large outlet drop. Primarily fine substrate upstream.. 18:21:40
3m high beaver dam just upstream of road.  Large wetland upstream.. 18:03:41

Bridge.  Stream was dry at time of assessment.
. 17:50:42

Several fish (RB) 40-120mm were observed in outlet pool. Rainbow trout were captured during phase 2 assessment sampling. Fish were also observed in pools upstream. Beaver activity near inlet. Big outlet drop. Gravels upstream are suitable for spawning resident fish. Good riparian vegetation and good habitat.. 11:12:52

Culvert is completely broken in half at the outlet. Fish observed downstream and RB noted upstream in FISS. Good habitat observed downstream during habitat confirmation. Tons of road fill. Inlet blocked with a log and debris creating an inlet drop. Signs of major erosion around pipe inlet suggesting pipe is undersized for the stream. MoTi chris_culvert_id: 1996861. 17:51:46

Reassessed as part of baseline assessment before hopeful future replacement. Fish sampling was conducted in a 75-meter stretch downstream and a 50-meter stretch upstream of the culvert, and fish 60 mm or greater were tagged with PIT tags. There are baffles made of metal in the culvert and Â¾ of the pipe is embedded with streambed material. The outlet of the pipe sits on a large pile of rip rap creating a 30 cm cascade that occurs approximately a meter after the outlet of the pipe.  There are two overflow pipes each at 0.9 m in diamter.        . 15:58:48

Two pipes each at 1.2m in diameter. Big outlet drop and deep outlet pool. Good habitat. Stream flows into inlet from the east but goes subsurface ~10m upstream of the pipe, with occasional small shallow pools. The stream channel is well defined so assuming this stream often has higher flows. Wetland type area to the east of the pipe inlet which is likely providing flow to the stream. ~8m wide area directly in front of the inlet that was dry but showed evidence that it likely has flowing water at higher flows. . 13:14:10

Two pipes each at 1.2m in diameter. One pipe has an inlet drop. Both pipes are embedded with only 1m at the inlet not embedded, so the culvert is functioning as embedded so low priority to fix. Really good habitat with deep pools and gravels. Sampled and caught RB.                    . 12:26:48
